item.title: Benj's Essential Sausage Casserole
item.description: Benj’s essential sausage casserole with a few add-ons and maybe some things i’ve forgotten. Ingredients 6 Herby Bangers - Tesco own brand veggie sausage. They’re bangin' bangers 400g tin Butter beans 300ml water 100ml Red wine or more… OR a red wine stock pot! - my new favourite thing. Veg Stock pot 3 handfuls of Kale 400g tin of chopped tomato Sprig of Thyme 1 Onion - chopped lengthways 200g mushrooms 1 tsp chilli powder 3 cloves of garlic To Serve

item.title: Panang Curry Paste
item.description: I’ve made this a fair few times! It’s definitely one of my go to pastes! Recipe comes from here Ingredients Spices 1 cinnamon stick 2 star anise 10 cardamom shells removed - or substitute with regular cardamom pods 10 whole cloves 2 tbsp coriander seeds 1 tbsp black peppercorns 2 tbsp cumin seeds Other Ingredients 3 stems lemongrass finely sliced - or substitute with 3 tbsp jarred/sliced lemongrass 2.

item.title: Red Onion Soup
item.description: One of my Grandmas recipes for red onion soup I found whilst rummaging around her stack of recipes she has in her kitchen. This is one of the few that didn’t involve copious amounts of meat! I found this particular recipe quite the riddle. Ingredients 2 oz butter 2lb red onion thinly sliced 1 tbsp veg oil 1 tsp salt ½ tsp brown sugar 1½ oz plain flour 3 pints brown stock ½ pint stout or brown ale Method Gently cook onions in butter and oil in a large pan for about 15 minutes.

item.title: Green Tomato Chutney
item.description: This is a recipe from my grandmas sister Ruby. Ingredients 1kg green tomatoes 500g white onion 500g apples 25g salt 8oz raisons 4oz sultanas 1 litre malt vinegar 350g demera sugar Method Slice or mince tomatoes, apples, onions Add raisins, salt, vinegar Simmer for 90 minutes Add sugar Cook until thick

item.title: Tomato Soup
item.description: Ingredients Roasted tomatoes: 1kg tomatoes, cut in half if using plum or into 5mm strips if not 6 cloves garlic, peeled 3 tablespoons olive oil Freshly ground salt and pepper Caramelized onions: ½ tablespoon olive oil 2 yellow onions, thinly sliced Additions to the soup: 10g basil leaves ½ teaspoon dried oregano 200-500ml cups water or vegetarian broth, depending on how thick you want the soup Freshly ground salt and pepper, to taste Method Preheat oven to 200C Roast tomato’s with garlic and olive oil for 40 mins.

item.title: Beetroot Dip
item.description: Ingredients 2 large beetroot - cooked 1/2 tsp cumin 1/2 tsp ground coriander 3 cloves of garlic Pinch of salt 300ml greek yogurt 1/2 lemon juiced Method Put it in a blender and blend it! Comments All the above ingredients are a rough estimation. Add bits at a time and enjoy the ride. Pictures

item.title: Kale Salad
item.description: Ingredients 2 sweet potatoes cut into 2cm cubes 400g (1 can) chick peas 1 tsp ground cumin 1 tsp ground paprika 200g of kale chilli flakes olive oil 20g chopped parsley Dressing 150g cashews 2 garlic cloves (roasted) 6 tbsp of almond milk 2 tsp dijon mustard 1 lemon - juiced pinch of salt Optional Flaked almonds - toasted Method Preheat oven to 190 Celsius Mix together sweet potato, chick peas, cumin, and paprika in a bowl with a pinch of salt and olive oil.

item.title: Gorgonzola Pasta
item.description: Sam would describe this recipe as ‘real indulgent’. Thanks Sam :) Ingredients 4 shallots - finely chopped 400g tin of chopped tomatoes 1/2 tsp chilli flakes 200ml single cream 250g of Gorgonzola - roughly chopped 2 cloves of garlic - finely chopped 20g basil - finely chopped Method Add a good glug of olive oil to a pan on medium heat and add the shallots. After one minute add the chilli flakes and garlic.

item.title: African Peanut Stew
item.description: Stew Ingredients 1-2 tbsp peanut oil 500g sweet potato - peeled and diced 1 x 400g tin of black-eyed peas, drained and rinsed / or black beans 1 x green chilli 3 tbsp tomato puree 1 x 400g tin of chopped tomatoes 500ml vegetable stock 125g smooth peanut butter 200g spinach 1 tbsp lemon juice Handful of corriander 2 spring onions Paste Ingredients 2 onions - roughly chopped 5 garlic cloves - roughly chopped 2 inch piece of ginger - roughly chopped 1 tsp paprika 2 tsp ground coriander 1 tsp ground turmeric 2 tsp cumin 1 tsp ground fenugreek 1 green chilli Method Blitz paste ingredients Add oil to pan and saute paste for 10 mins on a low/medium heat Add sweet potato, black eyed pas/beans, 1/2 green chilli, and tomato puree.

item.title: Lentil Ragu
item.description: An easy meal with minimal effort that gets better with age! Ingredients puy lentil and mushroom ragu (serves 8-10) 2 tablespoons olive oil 2 carrots, finely chopped 2 onions, finely chopped 300g chestnut mushrooms, finely chopped 4 cloves garlic, finely chopped 250g puy lentils 200ml red wine 2 tablespoon tomato puree 2x 400g tin of chopped tomatoes 1 litre vegetable stock 3 bay leaf 1 teaspoon dried oregano salt & pepper 20g chopped basil Method Fry onions and carrot in olive oil on a low/medium heat until onions become translucent (5-8 mins) Add the garlic and mushrooms until cooked through (5 mins) Add lentils, red wine, and tomato puree.

item.title: Spicy Beetroot Sandwich Filler
item.description: This sandwich filler comes from Lous friends mum. Its a belter! Ingrediants 2 grated boiled beetroot or 200g of shredded beetroot 100g Philadelphia cream cheese 1 Green chili Pepper and salt to taste 50g Grated cheddar Method add everything to a blender and coarsely blend Picture

item.title: Banana Bread
item.description: This recipe comes from my friend Tom who adapted the BBC Goodfoods recipe. For my take I don’t add chocolate to it because chocolate belongs in chocolate bars. Link to Tom’s website Here! Ingredients 125g margarine (or butter) 125g sugar (half white, half brown) 2 small eggs, beaten 125g flour (farine bise) 1 tsp baking powder 2 ripe bananas Handful walnuts Handful dark chocolate chunks Method Heat the oven to 190C.

item.title: Roasted Tomato
item.description: A quick recipe from my house mate Lou. A great afternoon snack! Ingredients 1 Beef tomato or tomato of your choice cut into 2-3cm chunks A few sprigs of thyme 3 Cloves of garlic - whole Olive oil Balsamic vinegar Method Preheat oven to 180 C Add tomato, thyme and garlic into oven tray and cover in oil Season with salt and pepper Roast for 20- 30 minutes Drizzle balsamic vinegar and remove thyme.

item.title: Leek and Mushroom Pie
item.description: Recipe taken from : Easy Peasy Foodie Ingredients 25 g butter 2 small leeks sliced 150 g chestnut mushrooms thinly sliced 200 g Quorn chicken pieces (or 400g leftover roast chicken or 2 small chicken breasts) 1 tablespoon plain flour 1 vegetable stock cube (or 1 chicken stock cube) 300 ml boiling water 300 ml crème fraîche 1 tablespoon thyme leaves Salt and pepper 500 g block puff pastry A small amount of milk 4 large Potato’s Method Pre-heat the oven to 220C / 200C fan / gas mark 7 / 425F.

item.title: Beetroot Risotto
item.description: Recipe taken from : BBC Good Food Ingredients 500g fresh beetroot 2 tbsp olive oil knob of butter 1 onion, finely chopped 1 garlic clove, finely chopped 250g risotto rice 150ml white wine 700ml hot vegetable stock handful grated parmesan (or vegetarian alternative) 4 tbsp soured cream handful chopped dill Method Heat oven to 180C/fan 160C/gas 4. Peel and trim the beetroots (use kitchen gloves if you don’t want your hands to get stained) and cut into large wedges.

item.title: One Pot Mexican Quinoa
item.description: Recipe taken from: Damn Delicious Ingredients 1 tablespoon olive oil 2 cloves garlic, minced 1 jalapeno, minced 1 cup quinoa 1 cup vegetable broth 1 (15-ounce) can black beans, drained and rinsed 1 (14.5 oz) can fire-roasted diced tomatoes 1 cup corn kernels, frozen, canned or roasted 1 teaspoon chili powder 1/2 teaspoon cumin Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste 1 avocado, halved, seeded, peeled and diced Juice of 1 lime 2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro leaves Method Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium high heat.

item.title: Flapjack
item.description: Ingredients 250g porridge oats 125g butter 125g brown sugar 3 tbsp golden syrup 50g walnuts 25g almonds Method Preheat oven to 180°C On a low heat add buter, sugar, and golden syrup to a pan. Heat until sugar has lost granularity Add porridge oats, walnuts, almonds, whatever else you want to add. Line a 20x20cm baking tray and pour oat mixture in. Place in oven for 20 mins or until golden brown.
